inference:
1st Equation:

$$x+y=(5-x)+(5-y)$$

$$x+y=5-x+5-y$$

$$x+y=10-x-y$$

$$x+y+x+y=10-x-y+x+y$$

$$2x+2y=10$$

$$2(x+y)=10$$

$$\Rightarrow x+y=5\cdots (1)$$

2nd Equation:

$$x-y=(x-1)+(y-1)$$

$$x-y=x-1+y-1$$

$$x-y=x+y-2$$

$$x-y-x-y=-2$$

$$-2y=-2$$

$$y=1\cdots (2)$$

Substituting (2) into (1)
$$x+1=5$$

$$x=5-1$$

$$\Rightarrow x=4$$

$$\boxed{\text{Final Answer: }(4,1)}$$
ground_truth:
Adding the equations, we get

$$2x=8\Rightarrow x=4.$$Substituting this into the first equation, we get

$$4+y=1+5-y\Rightarrow y=1.$$Thus the ordered pair is $\boxed{(4,1)}$.

question:
1st Equation:

$$x+y=(5-x)+(5-y)$$

$$x+y=5-x+5-y$$

$$x+y=10-x-y$$

$$x+y+x+y=10-x-y+x+y$$

$$2x+2y=10$$

$$2(x+y)=10$$

$$\Rightarrow x+y=5\cdots (1)$$

2nd Equation:

$$x-y=(x-1)+(y-1)$$

$$x-y=x-1+y-1$$

$$x-y=x+y-2$$

$$x-y-x-y=-2$$

$$-2y=-2$$

$$y=1\cdots (2)$$

Substituting (2) into (1)
$$x+1=5$$

$$x=5-1$$

$$\Rightarrow x=4$$

$$\boxed{\text{Final Answer: }(4,1)}$$

Adding the equations, we get

$$2x=8\Rightarrow x=4.$$Substituting this into the first equation, we get

$$4+y=1+5-y\Rightarrow y=1.$$Thus the ordered pair is $\boxed{(4,1)}$.
